bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, September 9, 1952

div1.p: Hench requests that Siler send him the names and addresses of the officers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. Hench wants to send the names to Nogueira in the hopes that they will be invited, or at least notified, about the dedication of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, September 9, 1952
div1.opener:
September 9, 1952
Colonel J. F. Siler
2220 20th Street N.W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
At the moment I cannot lay my hands on the minutes
of the last meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial
Association. I have a double set of files on
yellow fever matters - one at my office and one
at home. Sometimes I take material home to read
more leisurely and it does not get promptly filed.

In any event, could you kindly let me know at your
earliest convenience the names and addresses of the
officers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.
I want to send these names to Dr. Pedro Nogueira,
hoping that he will see to it that the Cuban Govern-
ment sends invitations to these officers, or at
least notifies the Walter Reed Memorial Association
of the impending dedication of the park and Camp
Lazear.
I enclose an air mail stamped envelope for reply.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
